definition.name: NXparameterizedmask

symbols.doc: These symbols will be used below to coordinate dimensions with the same lengths.

symbol.name: n_masks
symbol.doc: number of masks to be described

symbol.name: n1
symbol.doc: length of first index of mask array

symbol.name: n2
symbol.doc: length of second index of mask array

definition.doc: Mask or region of interest referencing some portion of a ``NXdata`` group described by a mask array.

field.name: usage
field.doc:
How this mask is used. Choices are limited to the following.
* ``Unionable`` : logical OR * ``Intersectable`` : logical AND * ``Selective`` : Selects a region of interest. No binary logic should be applied.

field.name: mask
field.doc:
The mask array.
This is a collection of 2D masks, each a labeled array, with each value representing a unique component.
A value of ``0`` (zero) represents inaction. In the context of a mask, this means the pixel is included (not masked).
A non-zero value represents action (mask the pixel).
Each unique non-zero value represents a separate region of interest.

link.name: data_link
link.doc: NeXus link to the data to which this mask is relevant.

group.name: parameters
group.doc:
The set of parameters relevant to a mask procedure.
Specifications for individual types are::
RectROI:NXparameterizedmask parameters:NXparameters type = “Rectangular” x_min: NX_INT y_min: NX_INT x_max: NX_INT y_max: NX_INT
...
Type of procedural definition. May be one of:
* Reciprocal_Space_q * Miller Indices * Rectangular * Circular * Annular * Annular_Arc * Polygon * Range * (...?)
